[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@genesislcap/foundation-layout](./foundation-layout.md) &gt; [FoundationLayout](./foundation-layout.foundationlayout.md) &gt; [registerItem](./foundation-layout.foundationlayout.registeritem.md)

## FoundationLayout.registerItem() method

Register an item with the layout system for later use

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
registerItem(config: Pick<RegisteredElementConfig, 'elements' | 'registration'>): string;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  config | Pick&lt;[RegisteredElementConfig](./foundation-layout.registeredelementconfig.md), 'elements' \| 'registration'&gt; | [RegisteredElementConfig](./foundation-layout.registeredelementconfig.md) configuration items for the new pane |

<b>Returns:</b>

string

- string defining the name of the registered item with the layout system (config.id if set).

## Exceptions

[LayoutUsageError](./foundation-layout.layoutusageerror.md) if you attempt to add an item before the layout has been initialised (before anything has been added via the declarative html API)

## Remarks

You would use this to register elements that you later want to load when using [FoundationLayout.loadLayout()](./foundation-layout.foundationlayout.loadlayout.md). Use [FoundationLayout.getRegisteredNames()](./foundation-layout.foundationlayout.getregisterednames.md) to see what components need to be registered for a certain config and then register them using this function before calling [FoundationLayout.loadLayout()](./foundation-layout.foundationlayout.loadlayout.md).
